titles.title: A bill to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to publish an annual report on the use of deepfake technology, and for other purposes.
Deepfake Report Act of 2019
Deepfake Report Act of 2019
Deepfake Report Act of 2019

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Johnson with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 116-93.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 197.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Consumer Protection and Commerce.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary:
Deepfake Report Act of 2019
This bill requires the Science and Technology Directorate in the Department of Homeland Security to report at specified intervals on the state of digital content forgery technology. Digital content forgery is the use of emerging technologies, including artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques, to fabricate or manipulate audio, visual, or text content with the intent to mislead.
